meanings.definition: To give a new form or body to something.
meanings.sent1: She reembodied the old dress into a beautiful scarf.
meanings.sent2: The artist reembodied the clay into a stunning sculpture.
meanings.sent3: After some magic, the pumpkin reembodied into a carriage!
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar reembodied into a graceful butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The old house was reembodied into a modern masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To bring back to life or existence in a new form.
meanings.sent1: The scientist reembodied the extinct flower species.
meanings.sent2: The myth told of a wizard who could reembody the dead.
meanings.sent3: The fairy godmother reembodied the lost memories of the princess.
meanings.sent4: The phoenix reembodies itself from its ashes.
meanings.sent5: The ancient legend spoke of a sorcerer who could reembody the departed souls.

meanings.sent1: The spirit reembodied in the haunted house every night.
meanings.sent2: The memories reembodied in the old photographs.
meanings.sent3: The superhero reembodied his powers after losing them temporarily.
meanings.sent4: The dream reembodied itself in a different form the next night.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tale told of a curse that caused souls to reembody in different bodies.
